intro: Dimerostemma aspilioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf dimerostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
